commit_message:
Add the spec for separate control for anti-spoofing

Change-Id: I04217615da711afb29e9de172883656e701a089a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/98/388398/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Separate Control for Anti-Spoofing =================================== Launchpad blueprint: blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/separate-control-for-anti-spoofing Launchpad RFE: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1633280 Currently security group and anti-spoofing are controlled in an all-or-nothing manner by port-security extension. There are cases that security group is required but anti-spoofing is not. This proposal seeks a way to split the control of security group and anti-spoofing. Problem Description =================== Port-security extension introduced a "port_security_enabled" Boolean type attribute to both network and port resources. If "port-security-enabled" is set to True, it enables both security group and anti-spoofing. If set to False, it disables both. From the NFV point of view, some VNFs require to disable anti-spoofing while keeping security groups since the services (e.g. routing, addressing) provided by these VNFs do not include security functions. In this case, the VNFs need security group to protect them. The existing "all-or-nothing" control of security group and anti-spoofing does not offer such flexibility. Proposed Change =============== Introduce a new extended attribute -- "anti_spoofing_enabled" to both networks and ports resourcs as defined in below. ANTISPOOFING = 'anti_spoofing_enabled' EXTENDED_ATTRIBUTES_2_0 = { 'networks': { ANTISPOOFING: {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'convert_to': converters.convert_to_boolean, 'enforce_policy': True, 'default': True, 'is_visible': True}, }, 'ports': { ANTISPOOFING: {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'convert_to': converters.convert_to_boolean, 'default': constants.ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED, 'enforce_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, } } The value of True means anti-spoofing is enabled on that network or port. False means anti-spoofing is disabled. The "anti_spoofing_enabled" attribute is optional. For network resources it has a default value of True. For ports, if not specified, it will fall back to the value of the network which this port is associated with. So if not specified explicitly, anti-spoofing is enabled for both network and port resources, this is backward compatible. If the values of network and port conflict, the value of port takes precedence. Data Model Impact ----------------- A DB field of "anti_spoofing_enabled" will be added to both network and port DB model. REST API Impact --------------- API extension for anti-spoofing control will be added. End user will be able to enable/disable anti-spoofing in a network or port granularity. Security Impact --------------- Disabling anti-spoofing will certainly expose some security risks, but it is done in a way of tenant admin will. And it is by default enabled. Notifications Impact -------------------- anti_spoofing_enabled attribute of network and port will be added to related notification. Performance Impact ------------------ None IPv6 Impact ----------- None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- ML2 plugin will be changed to support anti_spoofing extension. And we will use the current framework to notify l2 agent when the attribute is changed. Iptables firewall driver would be updated to add/update chains accordingly. Community Impact ---------------- NFV users who does not want ARP spoofing will be able to disable it. Alternatives ------------ * PortSecurity extension can be enriched to allow "port_security_enabled" attribute to accept String values other than Boolean values. For example, it can accept "disable_anti_spoofing" along with True and False. The request can remain backward compatible, but the response may return String value instead of Boolean values. This is not backward compatible. * New default security group rules which does not include ARP spoofing functionality. This will change the current default behavior thus not backward compatible. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- * Rui Zang (Primary) * Isaku Yamahata Work Items ---------- * anti-spoofing API extension * ML2 plugin reference implementation -- extension driver Dependencies ============ API-tests --------- None. Functional Tests ---------------- Necessary test cases will be added Fullstack Tests --------------- Related scenario test will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ User guide will be updated with how this feature can be enabled and used. Developer Documentation ----------------------- None API Documentation ----------------- API documentationi will be updated with detailed request and response information. References ==========

subject: Ensure online migrations can run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-29 11:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_db_setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/1c125daf381659f4d1dba05ff833a5a52fd033ca', 'message': "Ensure online migrations can run

The online migrations are disabled when they would have run
once per software version. However, when the task that
sets data_migration is skipped, it's not considered as failure
by ansible, and therefore the | succeeded will be true, removing
the ability to do the online data migrations.

This ensure that the fact task will be set to remove the need
for online data migrations when the relevant task has properly
run (not skipped).

Closes-Bug: #1713698

Change-Id: I0ed046252b24d4e02efb65216cc1c33aa470db9d
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure online migrations can run

The online migrations are disabled when they would have run
once per software version. However, when the task that
sets data_migration is skipped, it's not considered as failure
by ansible, and therefore the | succeeded will be true, removing
the ability to do the online data migrations.

This ensure that the fact task will be set to remove the need
for online data migrations when the relevant task has properly
run (not skipped).

Closes-Bug: #1713698

Change-Id: I0ed046252b24d4e02efb65216cc1c33aa470db9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/69/498769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove online_data_migrations-related tasks

The online_data_migrations command was only added
in Ocata [1], so these tasks aren't needed.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/upgrade.html#online-data-migrations

Related-Bug: #1713698
Relates-To: I2a4171742cef1b4f1358299d20d95c2a3d9c26ab
Change-Id: I24d65d9c5b557a033c5b369ccfaf8a32b34a9d99
